gcci.text: At a $3.18/hr average H100 price, spot capacity remains tight as enterprises lock multi‑year reservations, pushing capex to the top of hardware budgets and delaying refresh cycles until stronger supply normalizes pricing.

gtpi.text: With the average input price at $1.25/1M tokens, API vendors are pressured to compress margins, accelerating model compression and caching to defend share amid fierce price competition.

gagl.text: A 120 TWh annual load for AI workloads would strain grids and add tens of MtCO₂ unless paired with nuclear baseload and demand‑shifting, making carbon accounting critical.

aipi.text: Capital remains abundant but selective as efficiency drives margin pressure, raising bubble risk for undifferentiated startups while favoring hyperscalers with vertically integrated stacks.
